CatDescriptText: Mr. Dan Popey, bookkepper, 103 Theilmin Ave, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, August 22, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think that the visit of the Russian ruler, Khrushchev, will promote world peace?" answer reads: "It should help. I think that the situation is just the same as the President says when he said that the Russian leader doesn't know what is over here.  Once he sees just what is here, he probably will take a different attitude.  However, some people might throw rocks and stones at him, and in a way, you can't blame them."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Dan Popey wearing eyeglasses and necktie with diamond design, standing with hands on hips under Jenkins Arcade marquee, Liberty Avenue, Downtown
